message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper deals with gesture recognition using deep learning models, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper focuses on mobile hand gestures, which falls under the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of acceleration and angular velocity data also suggests a possible connection to multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of Fisher criterion for discriminative learning suggests a possible connection to neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
